intro: Sida orientalis, commonly known as the oriental sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate in shape, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
